intro: Chaptalia nipensis, commonly known as the Japanese chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
